definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

sentences.english: Sir, would you like to pay in cash or sign your bill?
sentences.chinese: 先生，请问您是用现金结账还是签单啊？

sentences.english: It gave visitors a strong impression they’d have to register in order to check out.
sentences.chinese: 它给访问者造成的强烈印象是他们必须注册才能结账。

sentences.english: By the way, what's the checkout time here?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，什么时间结账退房？

sentences.english: Departing guests are asked to check out by noon.
sentences.chinese: 离开旅馆的宾客须在中午前办理结账手续。

sentences.english: Do not let me re-enter the information when closing.
sentences.chinese: 别让我在结账的时候重新输入信息。

sentences.english: Each month we reconcile our check book with the bank statement.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个月都把支票簿与银行结账单核对一次。

sentences.english: By the way, I'd like to tell you that the check-out time is : noon, sir.
sentences.chinese: 先生，顺便告诉您，结账后离开旅馆时间是点。

sentences.english: Early check-in and late check out is subject to room availability.
sentences.chinese: 过早入住登记或过晚结账退房须视客房情况而定。

sentences.english: Grim checkout people urgent to get home.
sentences.chinese: 讨厌的人们急着结账回家。

sentences.english: I'm sorry that I haven't brought cashes with me .
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉我没带现金，可以用信用卡结账吗？

sentences.english: And the customer in front of you in line has so many items to check out.
sentences.chinese: 排在你之前的客人买了很多东西需要结账。

sentences.english: You've probably already seen the handy self-checkout counters at the grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 大概你已经在商店见过方面的自助结账柜台。

sentences.english: When Suchen asked the waitress for her check, Walter finally picked up his.
sentences.chinese: 苏晨要女侍者结账时，瓦尔特也终于付了帐。

sentences.english: Your time of check-out is at 8:30 tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 您结账的时间是明天早上8点半。

sentences.english: ROUND UP: Get cash back from your debit card at store checkouts.
sentences.chinese: 从商店结账处你的借记卡上拿回现金。

definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
to pay a sum of money/payment
to use a credit card (or swipe card, smart card etc)
